channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: "Battering RAM": $50 Hardware Attack Cracks Intel and AMD Secure CPU Enclaves
item.description:
At the Black Hat Europe 2025 conference, researchers from KU Leuven University demonstrated "Battering RAM," a novel hardware attack that completely undermines modern confidential computing technologies. Using a custom-built DDR4 interposer costing just $50, the attack can bypass the memory encrypti...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hamas-Linked APT "Ashen Lepus" Targets Middle East with New "AshTag" Malware
item.description:
The Hamas-affiliated advanced persistent threat (APT) group known as Ashen Lepus (or WIRTE) is conducting an ongoing espionage campaign targeting governmental and diplomatic entities in the Middle East. Researchers have identified a new, modular .NET malware suite named AshTag being used in these at...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Operation DupeHike" Espionage Campaign Targets Russian Corporate HR Depts
item.description:
A highly targeted cyber-espionage campaign, dubbed "Operation DupeHike," has been identified targeting employees in Russian corporations. Attributed to the threat actor cluster UNG0902, the campaign uses convincing social engineering lures, such as decoy documents about employee bonuses, to infiltra...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Unpatched Zero-Day in Gogs Git Service Actively Exploited to Gain SSH Access
item.description:
A critical, unpatched zero-day vulnerability in Gogs, a popular self-hosted Git service, is being actively exploited in the wild. Tracked as CVE-2025-8110 with a CVSS score of 8.7, the flaw is a bypass of a previously patched RCE and allows an attacker to overwrite arbitrary files, ultimately leadin...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: OPSEC Fail: North Korean Spy 'Trevor Greer' Exposed by Own Infostealer Infection
item.description:
In a major operational security (OPSEC) failure, a North Korean state-sponsored hacker was unmasked after accidentally infecting their own machine with commodity infostealer malware like LummaC2. The leaked logs, analyzed by Flashpoint and Hudson Rock, exposed the digital life of an operative using ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: GrayBravo MaaS Fuels Cybercrime with CastleLoader Malware
item.description:
The cybercrime ecosystem is becoming more industrialized with the rise of Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) operations like 'GrayBravo.' According to Recorded Future's Insikt Group, GrayBravo is developing and distributing a sophisticated loader called CastleLoader to at least four separate threat cluster...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followe...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cloudflare Outage Hits 28% of Global Traffic After Faulty React2Shell Patch
item.description:
Cloudflare, a leading internet infrastructure provider, experienced a 25-minute global outage on December 5, 2025, that impacted approximately 28% of its HTTP traffic and made numerous popular websites inaccessible. The company quickly confirmed the disruption was not a cyberattack but was self-infl...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical 7-Zip RCE Vulnerability Now Under Active Exploitation
item.description:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the popular 7-Zip file archiver, tracked as CVE-2025-11001, is now being actively exploited in the wild. The path traversal flaw, which affects versions prior to 25.0.0, can be triggered when a user extracts a specially crafted malicious archiv...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Exposes 'BRICKSTORM' Backdoor Used by Chinese State Actors to Infiltrate US Government
item.description:
The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), NSA, and Canadian Centre for Cyber Security have jointly exposed a sophisticated backdoor named 'BRICKSTORM'. According to the December 4, 2025 advisory, People's Republic of China (PRC) state-sponsored actors are using this malware to ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack
